reviews.review_msg: Honestly one of the best professors I've had at SFU so far. He teaches a really tough subject but he cares a lot about his students' success and always checks in to make sure we understand the material before moving on. He is very kind and always makes students feel comfortable enough to ask for help. My advice for 204: make use of his office hours

Dan's exams are extremely precise in their wording and answers, but hisclass is one of my favourites. He's clearly passionate about the subject and teaching. Dan's lectures are clear with many indications of testing material during lecture. His lecture style is friendly and approachable. His slides are easily studied with lecture notes.

Dan is amazing professor, as long as you ask questions and actively participate he's very forgiving. He's an expert in his field and is ready to teach you as much as you want to learn. Dan is a bro. (I took 204, 309, 404 and 408 with Dan)

Dan Gibson is a solid prof in the Earth Science Department. He cares about his students and is available for help. He isn't amazing at explaining things so I had to spend a lot of time reviewing. The theory exams aren't bad, but the lab exams are BRUTAL.

Structure is a difficult class and it is true that the labs take a ridiculous amount of time. He is very helpful when you have questions and is a fair (albeit picky) marker. He doesn't explain every step of the lab before hand, but I think that helps in the learning. I definitely learned a lot!

Swears in class, doesn't explain material clearly.  When given directions on how to do labs, labs are then given with backwards information, opposite to what was explained. Labs on average take 20 hours outside of lab. If you're taking any other course, you won't have enough time to read the text book or notes.  Even TA's don't understand material.
